title: General interactivity
text: pytourr package offers multiple different types general interactivity. following operations can performed elements frame left. Feature selection Subset selection highlighting Resetting original subsets Updating current display Animating currently loaded tours Saving projections subsets Initiating new tours Examples displays can found .

title: General interactivity
code: # Load required libraries library(tourr) library(reticulate) library(pytourr)  # Initialize python backend init_env()

title: General interactivity
code: data("flea") data <- apply(flea[,1:6], 2, function(x) (x-mean(x))/sd(x)) clusters <- as.numeric(flea$species) flea_subspecies <- unique(flea$species)  guided_tour_history <- save_history(data,                                     tour_path = guided_tour(holes())) grand_tour_history_1d <- save_history(data,                                       tour_path = grand_tour(d=1))  half_range <- max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) feature_names <- colnames(data)  init_env()  obj1 <- list(type = "2d_tour", obj = guided_tour_history) obj2 <- list(type = "1d_tour", obj = grand_tour_history_1d) obj3 <- list(type = "scatter", obj = c("tars1", "tars2")) obj4 <- list(type = "hist", obj = "head")  interactive_tour(data=data,                  plot_objects=list(obj1, obj2, obj3, obj4),                  feature_names=feature_names,                  half_range = half_range,                  n_plot_cols=2,                  preselection=clusters,                  preselection_names=flea_subspecies,                  n_subsets = 5,                  display_size=4.5)

title: General interactivity
text: list features can found top left. feature checkbox next . features selected deselected checking unchecking respective checkboxes.

title: General interactivity
text: list subsets can found features. subset checkbox next . subsets selected checking respective checkboxes next . subset active, datapoints selected one interactive plots moved subset. colored patches next subsets indicate color datapoints within respective subset. transparency datapoints subsets can changed clicking colored patches next subset names. names subsets can changed writing textboxes.

title: General interactivity
text: current subset selection can easily reset clicking “Reset original selection” button.

title: General interactivity
text: current display can updated clicking “Update frames” button. can useful plots haven’t updated properly, one wants reset shown projections original projections one wants jump specific frame selected texboxes button.

title: General interactivity
text: currently loaded tours can animated checking checkbox “Update frames” button. interval next frames loaded can changed textbox next checkbox.

title: General interactivity
text: currently displayed projections subsets can saved .csv clicking “Save projections subsets” button. produce file browser one can choose directory files saved . saved files .png file figure .csv file maps indices datapoints subsets .csv files projection matrices displayed tours

title: General interactivity
text: New tours can initiated first choosing tour one wants compute pressing “Run tour”. Currently, local tours guided tours indices holes LDA available. Local tours initiated currently displayed projections. can therefore used explore projections similar displayed one. pressing “Reset original tour” one can return originally loaded tours.

title: Plot objects
text: pytourr package offers multiple different types display elements. provided interactive_tour function launches GUI. plot object list containing type object. type specifies, kind display generated. object provides additional information required construct display. plot objects stored list can given interactive_tour function. currently supported displays : 1d tour 2d tour scatterplot histogram mosaic plot heatmap categorical cluster interface Examples displays can found .

title: Plot objects
code: # Load required libraries library(tourr) library(reticulate) library(pytourr) library(flexclust)  # Initialize python backend init_env()

title: Plot objects
code: # Load dataset data("flea")  # Prepare objects for later us clusters_flea <- as.numeric(flea$species) flea_subspecies <- unique(flea$species)  # Standardize data and calculate half_range flea <- apply(flea[,1:6], 2, function(x) (x-mean(x))/sd(x)) feature_names_flea <- colnames(flea) half_range_flea <- max(sqrt(rowSums(flea^2)))

title: Plot objects
code: # Load dataset and set seed data("winterActiv") set.seed(42)  # Perform kmeans clustering  clusters_winter <- stepcclust(winterActiv, k=6, nrep=20) clusters_winter <- clusters_winter@cluster  # Get the names of our features feature_names_winter <- colnames(winterActiv)

title: Plot objects
text: display one dimensional tours, first generated saved using save_history function tourr package. information available types tours please visit tour path construction.

previous_headings: Currently supported display types > One dimensional tour
title: Plot objects
code: guided_tour_flea_1d <- save_history(flea,                                     tour_path = guided_tour(holes(),1))  obj_flea_1d_tour <- list(type = "1d_tour",          # type of display                          obj = guided_tour_flea_1d) # 1d tour history

previous_headings: Currently supported display types > One dimensional tour
title: Plot objects
text: Changeing frames tour: frames current tour can changed pressing left arrow-key last frame right arrow-key next frame. current frame displayed frame left. Projection manipulation: projection can manipulated clicking one arrowheads right mouse-button dragging . Subselection: datapoins within subset can changed clicking one bars histogram. datapoints within bar moved subset currently selected left.

title: Plot objects
text: display two dimensional tours, first generated saved using save_history function tourr package. information available types tours please visit tour path construction.

previous_headings: Currently supported display types > Two dimensional tour
title: Plot objects
code: grand_tour_flea_2d <- save_history(flea,                                    tour_path = grand_tour(d=2))  obj_flea_2d_tour <- list(type = "2d_tour",         # type of display                          obj = grand_tour_flea_2d) # 2d tour history

previous_headings: Currently supported display types > Two dimensional tour
title: Plot objects
text: Changeing frames tour: frames current tour can changed pressing left arrow-key last frame right arrow-key next frame. current frame displayed frame left. Projection manipulation: projection can manipulated clicking one arrowheads right mouse-button dragging . Subselection: datapoins within subset can changed pressing left mouse-button drawing lasso around datapoints selected. datapoints within lasso moved subset currently selected left.

text: display scatter plot, features displayed x y axis provided form two dimensional vector.

title: Plot objects
text: Subselection: datapoins within subset can changed pressing left mouse-button drawing lasso around datapoints selected. datapoints within lasso moved subset currently selected left.

title: Plot objects
text: Subselection: datapoins within subset can changed clicking one bars histogram. datapoints within bar moved subset currently selected left.

title: Plot objects

code: obj_winter_mosaic <- list(type = "mosaic",   # type of display                   obj = c("subgroups_on_y")) # whether subgroups x or y axis

title: Plot objects
text: Currently way directly interacting mosaic plot.

title: Plot objects
text: display heatmap, metric calculated plotted selected. One can choose “Total fraction”, “Intra cluster fraction” “Intra feature fraction”. total fraction=∑=1s∑j=1pcij/n\text{total fraction}=\sum_{= 1}^{s} \sum_{j = 1}^{p} c_{ij}/n intra cluster fraction=∑=1s∑j=1pcij/ci\text{intra cluster fraction}=\sum_{= 1}^{s} \sum_{j = 1}^{p} c_{ij}/c_{} intra feature fraction=∑=1s∑j=1pcij/cj\text{intra feature fraction}=\sum_{= 1}^{s} \sum_{j = 1}^{p} c_{ij}/c_{j} nn total number observations, cc counts, pp features ss subgroups/clusters.

title: Plot objects
code: obj_winter_heatmap <- list(type = "heatmap",          # type of display                            obj = c("Total fraction")) # initial metric

title: Plot objects
text: Metric selection: currently displayed metric can changed using dropdown menu within frame left. details metrics can found .

title: Plot objects
text: display categorical cluster interface, metric calculated plotted selected. One can choose “Total fraction”, “Intra cluster fraction” “Intra feature fraction”. total fraction=∑=1s∑j=1pcij/n\text{total fraction}=\sum_{= 1}^{s} \sum_{j = 1}^{p} c_{ij}/n intra cluster fraction=∑=1s∑j=1pcij/ci\text{intra cluster fraction}=\sum_{= 1}^{s} \sum_{j = 1}^{p} c_{ij}/c_{} intra feature fraction=∑=1s∑j=1pcij/cj\text{intra feature fraction}=\sum_{= 1}^{s} \sum_{j = 1}^{p} c_{ij}/c_{j} nn total number observations, cc counts, pp features ss subgroups/clusters.

title: Plot objects
text: Metric selection: currently displayed metric can changed using dropdown menu within frame left. details metrics can found .

title: Plot objects
text: various plot objects can displayed interactive_tour function.
code: # interactive_tour call of flea dataset. Insert plot objects of your liking. interactive_tour(data=flea,                  feature_names=feature_names_flea,                  plot_objects=list(obj_flea_2d_tour),                  half_range = half_range_flea,                  n_plot_cols=2,                  preselection=clusters_flea,                  n_subsets = 3,                  preselection_names=flea_subspecies,                  display_size=10) # interactive_tour call of winterActiv dataset. Insert plot objects of your liking. interactive_tour(data=winterActiv,                  feature_names=feature_names_winter,                  plot_objects=list(obj_winter_cat_clust),                  half_range = 3,                  n_plot_cols=2,                  preselection=clusters_winter,                  n_subsets = 10,                  display_size=10)

title: Interactive tourrs using python
text: package extension tourr R-package. general overview tourr package please refer tourr documentation. pytourr adds interactive displays functionality tourr allowing users direct path tours.

title: Interactive tourrs using python
text: can install development version pytourr github : Make sure git installed. can download install git https://git-scm.com/downloads don’t installed.
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("mmedl94/pytourr")

title: Interactive tourrs using python
text: Running example code might result following error resolve , delete erroneous virtual environment, build new one older Python version provide directories tcl tk installations. Running example now probably throw: means tkinter find tk tcl installations. provide correct directories manually. located somewhere (please modify according system!) located please run (please modify according system!) directories tcl tk installations set anew beginning R session.
code: Error: Required version of NumPy not available: incompatible NumPy binary version 33554432 (expecting version 16777225) # Delete the old enironment, might require a restart of R reticulate::virtualenv_remove("r-pytourr")  # Install the stable Python version reticulate::install_python(version="3.8.10")  # Build new virtual environment reticulate::virtualenv_create(envname = "r-pytourr", version="3.8.10")  # Initiate Python environment as usual init_env() Error in py_call_impl(callable, call_args$unnamed, call_args$named) :    _tkinter.TclError: Can't find a usable init.tcl in the following directories:     C:/some/directory/  This probably means that Tcl wasn't installed properly. # tcl location C:/Users/user/AppData/Local/r-reticulate/r-reticulate/pyenv/pyenv-win/versions/3.8.10/tcl/tcl8.6  # tk location C:/Users/user/AppData/Local/r-reticulate/r-reticulate/pyenv/pyenv-win/versions/3.8.10/tk/tk8.6 Sys.setenv(TCL_LIBRARY = "C:/Users/user/AppData/Local/r-reticulate/r-reticulate/pyenv/pyenv-win/versions/3.8.10/tcl/tcl8.6") Sys.setenv(TK_LIBRARY = "C:/Users/user/AppData/Local/r-reticulate/r-reticulate/pyenv/pyenv-win/versions/3.8.10/tk/tk8.6")

title: Interactive tourrs using python
text: run interactive tour first initialize python backend can display saved tour objects, scatterplots histograms interactive_tour()
code: library(pytourr) init_env() library(tourr) library(reticulate) data <- apply(flea[,1:6], 2, function(x) (x-mean(x))/sd(x)) clusters <- as.numeric(flea$species) flea_subspecies <- unique(flea$species)  guided_tour_history <- save_history(data,                                     tour_path = guided_tour(holes())) grand_tour_history_1d <- save_history(data,                                       tour_path = grand_tour(d=1))  half_range <- max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) feature_names <- colnames(data)  init_env()  obj1 <- list(type = "2d_tour", obj = guided_tour_history) obj2 <- list(type = "1d_tour", obj = grand_tour_history_1d) obj3 <- list(type = "scatter", obj = c("tars1", "tars2")) obj4 <- list(type = "hist", obj = "head")  interactive_tour(data=data,                  plot_objects=list(obj1, obj2, obj3, obj4),                  feature_names=feature_names,                  half_range = half_range,                  n_plot_cols=2,                  preselection=clusters,                  preselection_names=flea_subspecies,                  n_subsets = 5,                  display_size=5)

what: Initialize anaconda environment used for python backend — init_env
title: Initialize anaconda environment used for python backend — init_env
text: Initialize anaconda environment used python backend

title: Initialize anaconda environment used for python backend — init_env
code: init_env(env_name = "r-pytourr", virtual_env = "virtual_env", local = FALSE)

title: Initialize anaconda environment used for python backend — init_env
text: env_name string defines name python environment reticulate uses. can useful one wants use preinstalled python environment. virtual_env either "virtual_env" "anaconda". "virtual_env" creates virtual environment, advantage GUI looks much nicer previous python installation required,setup environment can error prone. "anaconda" installs python environment via Anaconda, can stable, GUI looks dated.

title: Initialize anaconda environment used for python backend — init_env
code: init_env(env_name="r-pytourr", virtual_env = "virtual_env") #> Installing pyenv ... #> Done! pyenv has been installed to '/home/runner/.local/share/r-reticulate/pyenv/bin/pyenv'. #> + /home/runner/.local/share/r-reticulate/pyenv/bin/pyenv update #> + /home/runner/.local/share/r-reticulate/pyenv/bin/pyenv install --skip-existing 3.10.12 #> Using Python: /home/runner/.pyenv/versions/3.10.12/bin/python3.10 #> Creating virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ...  #> + /home/runner/.pyenv/versions/3.10.12/bin/python3.10 -m venv /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr #> Done! #> Installing packages: pip, wheel, setuptools #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade pip wheel setuptools #> Installing packages: numpy #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user numpy #> Virtual environment 'r-pytourr' successfully created. #> Using virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ... #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user pandas #> Using virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ... #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user matplotlib #> Using virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ... #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user customtkinter #> Using virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ... #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user statsmodels #> Using virtual environment 'r-pytourr' ... #> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-pytourr/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user seaborn #> Python environment "r-pytourr" successfully loaded

what: R wrapper for the interactive_tour function written on python — interactive_tour
title: R wrapper for the interactive_tour function written on python — interactive_tour
text: R wrapper interactive_tour function written python

title: R wrapper for the interactive_tour function written on python — interactive_tour
code: interactive_tour(   data,   plot_objects,   feature_names,   half_range,   n_plot_cols,   preselection = FALSE,   preselection_names = FALSE,   n_subsets = 3,   display_size = 5 )

title: R wrapper for the interactive_tour function written on python — interactive_tour
text: data dataset want investigate plot_objects named list objects want displayed. entry requires definition type display specification plotted. feature_names names features dataset half_range factor influences scaling displayed tour plots. Small values lead spread datapoints (might fit plotting area), large values lead data compact. provided good estimate calculated used. n_plot_cols specifies number columns grid final display. preselection vector specifies subset datapoint put initially. preselection_names vector specifies names preselection subsets n_subsets total number available subsets (10). display_size rough size subplot inches

what: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
text: Modification render_proj() function tourr half_range calculated max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) can provided arg

title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
code: render_proj_inter(   data,   prj,   half_range = NULL,   axis_labels = NULL,   obs_labels = NULL,   limits = 1,   position = "center" )

title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
text: data matrix, data frame containing numeric columns, standardised mean 0, sd 1 prj projection matrix axis_labels axes displayed obs_labels labels observations available interactive mouseover limits value setting lower upper limits projected data, default 1 position position axes: center (default), bottomleft

title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
text: list containing projected data, circle segments axes

title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
code: data(flea) #> Warning: data set ‘flea’ not found flea_std <- apply(flea[,1:6], 2, function(x) (x-mean(x))/sd(x)) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'flea' not found prj <- basis_random(ncol(flea[,1:6]), 2) #> Error in basis_random(ncol(flea[, 1:6]), 2): could not find function "basis_random" p <- render_proj(flea_std, prj) #> Error in render_proj(flea_std, prj): could not find function "render_proj"
